gov.usgs.volcanoes.core.legacy.plot.color

Class Spectrum

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.usgs.volcanoes.core.legacy.plot.color.Spectrum
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GradientSpectrum, Jet, Jet2

    public class Spectrum
extends Object

    A utility class for working with color spectra. This class is used by all of the Valve plotting classes that deal with color spectra: spectrograms, earthquake hypocenter times, etc.

    This class is meant to be subclassed by a class that contains the color information and therefore has a protected constructor -- it cannot be instantiated directly. See the Jet class for a further information regarding the use of this class.

    $Log: not supported by cvs2svn $
    Author:
    Dan Cervelli

      byte[] paletteBytes
      The bytes (color values) that make up the palette

      • renderScale

        public void renderScale(Graphics2D g,
               double x,
               double y,
               double width,
               double height,
               boolean vertical,
               boolean box)
        Draws a not particularly intelligent color scale bar.
        Parameters:
        g - the graphics object upon which to render
        x - the x-pixel coordinate of the scale bar
        y - the y-pixel coordinate of the scale bar
        width - the width of the scale bar
        height - the height of the scale bar
        vertical - whether or not the scale bar should be vertical
        box - whether or not to draw a box around the scale bar
